title: Designing an Optimal Sensor Network via Minimizing Information Loss
summary: This paper introduces a model-based criterion for optimal sensor placement that minimizes information loss using physics-based simulations and variational Gaussian processes. It improves experimental design efficiency for spatiotemporal monitoring tasks.
author_full_name: Daniel Waxman, Fernando Llorente, Katia Lamer, Petar M. Djurić

title: Developing Synthetic Microdata Through Machine Learning for Firm-Level Business Surveys
summary: This work describes machine learning methods, especially CART models, to generate synthetic firm-level microdata that preserves privacy while maintaining statistical utility, addressing challenges of business survey confidentiality.
author_full_name: Jorge Cisneros Paz, Timothy Wojan, Matthew Williams, Jennifer Ozawa, Robert Chew, Kimberly Janda, Timothy Navarro, Michael Floyd, Christine Task

title: Enhancing Retrieval-Augmented Generation with Entity Linking for Educational Platforms
summary: This paper proposes ELERAG, a hybrid RAG system combining semantic similarity and Wikidata entity linking to improve retrieval accuracy and factual grounding for educational question answering in Italian.
author_full_name: Francesco Granata, Francesco Poggi, Misael Mongiovì
